_meanings:
{@--2@}
As the subject of a sentence it agrees
in gender and number with the 
predicate without reference to the
noun to which it refers; {#etad#} ( 
{#SavalA#}) {#me DanaM#}; but may sometimes
remain in the neuter; {#etadeva guruzu#}
{#vfttiH#} <ls>Ms. 2. 206.</ls>

{@--4@} It is used in 
connection with a relative clause, in
which case the relative generally
follows; {#pracCannavaMcakAstvete ye#} 
{#stenAwavikAdayaH#} <ls>Ms. 9. 257.</ls>

one who does anything
for the second time.

one
who does anything for the first
time.
